SENT.plain: Five infants and children with angiographically occult vascular malformations of the brain detected by computed tomography (CT) are presented
Four malformations were located in the cerebral hemisphere, and one was in the brain stem
CT demonstrated high density lesions with little or no enhancement after infusion of the contrast material
The malformations were resected and histologically proven
These lesions are uncommon during infancy and childhood and mimic gliomas clinically and radiographically
The need for surgical extirpation of these lesions is stressed
